Package org.hallebarde.recrutement.api.storage

Interface Registry<T>

Type Parameters:
T - the type of entities managed by this registry
All Superinterfaces:
Map<String,Function<Options,T>>
public interface Registry<T> extends Map<String,Function<Options,T>>
Registries store information about the various classes that implement gameplay related types, like Item. A registry simply is a map with String keys and object constructors as values. The keys are the registered object type ID and the values are constructor that take an Options object as parameter. When the game loads the world and custom entities are specified within the world files, the game will use the relevant registry to instantiate the relevant class. Registries should only be written before the world is loaded (in your plugins Plugin.onLoad(Game, PluginMetadata, Logger) method. Writing to one at a latter stage is undefined behavior and may make your server unstable.

  • Method Details

    • instantiate

      T instantiate(String id, Options options)
      Gets an instance from this registry, using a specific id and options.
      Parameters:
      id - the id
      options - the options to pass to the constructor
      Returns:
      a new object, or null if the given id is not known to this registry
